snippet: Critics claim cars commonly used to carry crude oil and other petroleum products do not have enough safety features to prevent a spill.
abstract: Derailment of freight train carrying crude oil in Lynchburg, Va, serves as reminder that basic safety features of the oil-by-rails business remain vastly inadequate, despite a flurry of emergency orders by federal regulators; some rail operators like BNSF have moved to update their safeguards, but progress remains slow.
lead_paragraph: Critics claim cars commonly used to carry crude oil and other petroleum products do not have enough safety features to prevent a spill.
